page.title: 15St.Peter's Ch.Monkwearmouth.
page.content: Monkwearmouth got its name because the land belonged to the monks of the monastery at Jarrow.South of the river was called Bishopwearmouth,the land belonging to the Bishop of Durham.In 674 AD. a church and monastery were built at Monkwearmouth by St.Benedict Biscop.The west wall and tower of the present church are those built over 1300 years ago.The Venerable Bede spent part of his life here-entering the monastery at the age of 7 in the year 681 AD.He was a monk here until he moved to St.Paul's Monastery at Jarrow. On the 19th.March 1984,an unwelcome visitor set fire to the church and caused damage at over a quarter of a million pounds.Restoration will take many years to complete.
